CatDescriptText: Gardner White, 1101 Wheeler Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 22, 1958, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think that there will be an economic depression in near future like the one in the early thirties?" answer reads: "I don't know. It depends on whether or not there are jobs.  If business picks up, I don't think that there will be a depression.  I can't say whether or not things will pick up, but it doesn't look too good."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Gardner White wearing felted hat with braided band, eyeglasses, and light colored coat, standing in front of marble pillar in corridor with other people and store windows on either side
